description:
I like how the sidebar disappears when the window is small enough. My least favourite thing about the official desktop app is that the sidebar never goes away.
Currently (version 0.15) there is still a lot of features that haven't been implemented compared to the official desktop version

The app has a potential, but at the moment i cannot recommend it for stable use. Despite this it has a great design and once most of the bugs are resolved it would be a great alternative to the old-looking official signal app.
summary: Great app, would not yet recommend

description:
PMOS Stable. PPP.

Initially trying to link it wasnt working. The application would error out with error code 406 or 106 i believe. It was failing to download from signal.

Typically the linking would work correctly then fail at syncing anything. After numerous attempts, I linked the PPP and let my phone sit on the charger while doing other things. When I came back it actually synced properly. No error codes and messages sent

Wish you luck! Stay persistent if it doesnt work. I uninstalled and reinstalled at least 3 times
Overall, it's great, but for me to use it, the user profile pictures need to be displayed and messages would need to be presented in a more modern way.
It worked on Librem 5 off the bat, which is great. Thank you, dev
I'm really impressed. There are definitely missing feautres, and sometimes my messages fail to send properly, but other than that, I am very pleased and hope development continues.
summary: The Only Decent Option on Wayland
